Key Arguments: The legislation would establish ACMA as a powerful censorship body.
ACMA would control online content through industry codes enforced by Big Tech.
ACMA lacks the ability to determine what is true or false.
The legislation represents outsourced state censorship and is totalitarian in nature.
The government should not determine 'truth' for the public.
Notable Quotes: This proposed legislation sets up the Australian Media and Communications Authority (ACMA) as a powerful censorship organ of the state.
This is outsourced state censorship, totalitarian in scope, designed to control the public conversation and camouflaged as protection.
